intro: Epacris × kinghornii, commonly known as the Kinghorn's epacris, is a hybrid plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late winter to spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
